titleStmt.title: The Authours Epitaph, made by himselfe.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: The Authours Epitaph, made by himselfe.

monogr.title: The prerogatiue of parlaments in England : proued in a dialogue (pro & contra) betweene a councellour of state and a iustice of peace. Written by the worthy (much lacked and lamented) Sir W.R. Kt. deceased. Dedicated to the Kings Maiesty, and to the House of Parlament now assembled. Preserued to be now happily (in these distracted times) published, and printed at Hamburgh. 1628
monogr.author: Raleigh, Walter, Sir

div.head: The Authours Epitaph, made by himselfe.
div.l: EVen such is Time, which takes in trust
Our Youth, and Ioy's, and all wee haue,
And payes vs but with age and dust,
Which in the darke and silent graue,
When wee haue wandred all our wayes,
Shuts vp the story of our daies:
And from which Earth, and Graue, and Dust
The Lord shall raise mee vp I trust.
